box2D.collision.shapes.B2PolygonShape

type
class
extends
B2Shape
Convex polygon. The vertices must be in CCW order for a right-handed coordinate system with the z-axis coming out of the screen.

Static Methods

asArray(vertices : Array<Dynamic>, vertexCount : Float) : B2PolygonShape

asBox(hx : Float, hy : Float) : B2PolygonShape

asEdge(v1 : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2, v2 : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2) : B2PolygonShape

Set this as a single edge.

asOrientedBox(hx : Float, hy : Float, ?center : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2, ?angle : Float) : B2PolygonShape

asVector(vertices : Array<box2D.common.math.B2Vec2>, vertexCount : Float) : B2PolygonShape

computeCentroid(vs : Array<box2D.common.math.B2Vec2>, count : Int) : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2

parameters
vs vector of b2Vec specifying a polygon
count length of vs
returns
the polygon centroid
Computes the centroid of the given polygon

computeOBB(obb : box2D.collision.B2OBB, vs : Array<box2D.common.math.B2Vec2>, count : Int) : Void

see
http://www.geometrictools.com/Documentation/MinimumAreaRectangle.pdf
Computes a polygon's OBB

set(other : B2Shape) : Void

overrides box2D.collision.shapes.B2Shape

setAsArray(vertices : Array<Dynamic>, ?vertexCount : Float) : Void

Copy vertices. This assumes the vertices define a convex polygon. It is assumed that the exterior is the the right of each edge.

setAsBox(hx : Float, hy : Float) : Void

parameters
hx the half-width.
hy the half-height.
Build vertices to represent an axis-aligned box.

Copy vertices. This assumes the vertices define a convex polygon. It is assumed that the exterior is the the right of each edge.
